snippet: The Social Security Administration underestimates how long Americans will live. As a result, the trust funds will run out two years earlier than the government has predicted.
abstract: Op-Ed article by government Prof Gary King and demographer Samir S Soneji warns that Social Security Administration underestimates how long Americans will live and how much trust funds will need to pay out, and as result, trust funds will run out two years earlier than government has predicted if nothing is done; outlines solutions for keeping Social Security alive.

byline.original: By GARY KING and SAMIR S. SONEJI

lead_paragraph: The Social Security Administration underestimates how long Americans will live. As a result, the trust funds will run out two years earlier than the government has predicted.

headline.seo: Social Security: It’s Worse Than You Think
headline.main: Social Security: It’s Worse Than You Think
headline.print_headline: Social Security: It’s Worse Than You Think
